description.raw:
## Random world generation

1. Install Ruby:

        sudo apt-get install ruby2.5 ruby2.5-dev

1. Go to the worlds directory

        cd  subt_gazebo/worlds

1. Run erb to generate a random world with default params

        erb tile.world.erb > cave.world
 
1. Try different options, such as `n=3` to generate a 3x3 world:

        erb n=3 tile.world.erb > cave_3x3.world

1. ... or s=100 to set the random seed

        erb s=100 tile.world.erb > cave_s100.world

1. In the future, the same script could be used for mines as long as the meshes follow the same naming scheme

Randomly generated and committed cave world:

![Screenshot from 2018-08-09 17-55-43.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1886489238-Screenshot_from_2018-08-09_17-55-43.png)

## Cave world

* I'm not using the `cave_tile_ramp` yet, which will need logic for adding new "storeys"
* I didn't add the game logic plugin or the gates because those seem to be very specific to the lava tube for now

## Launch

* Substituted `lava_tube.launch` with `competition.launch`, which loads the lava tube by default, for example:

        roslaunch subt_gazebo competition.launch

* Other worlds can be used by setting the `scenario` argument, for example, to use the cave world:

        roslaunch subt_gazebo competition.launch scenario:=cave

* Also adapted the `subt_example` launch files to use this. So by default they still do what they used to (`lava_tube`), but you can pass `scenario` to override it, for example:

        roslaunch subt_example jackal.launch scenario:=cave

    ![jackalstart.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1334431747-jackalstart.png)

    or

        roslaunch subt_example iris.launch scenario:=cave

    ![irisstart.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3585875739-irisstart.png)

    or 

        roslaunch subt_example husky.launch scenario:=cave

    ![huskystart.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1809813129-huskystart.png)

## Updates 1b43c62

* Outside staging area
* Using the pre-existing cave entrance as a placeholder for now
* Scaled blockers so they cover the whole exit
* Support rectangular layouts for longer caves
* Outside lighting

![cave_5.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/199001242-cave_5.png)
![cave_6.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3936076220-cave_6.png)
description.html:
Random world generation

  1. Install Ruby:

    sudo apt-get install ruby2.5 ruby2.5-dev

  2. Go to the worlds directory

    cd  subt_gazebo/worlds

  3. Run erb to generate a random world with default params

    erb tile.world.erb > cave.world

  4. Try different options, such as n=3 to generate a 3x3 world:

    erb n=3 tile.world.erb > cave_3x3.world

  5. ... or s=100 to set the random seed

    erb s=100 tile.world.erb > cave_s100.world

  6. In the future, the same script could be used for mines as long as the meshes follow the same naming scheme

Randomly generated and committed cave world:

Cave world

  • I'm not using the cave_tile_ramp yet, which will need logic for adding new "storeys"
  • I didn't add the game logic plugin or the gates because those seem to be very specific to the lava tube for now

Launch

  • Substituted lava_tube.launch with competition.launch, which loads the lava tube by default, for example:

    roslaunch subt_gazebo competition.launch

  • Other worlds can be used by setting the scenario argument, for example, to use the cave world:

    roslaunch subt_gazebo competition.launch scenario:=cave

  • Also adapted the subt_example launch files to use this. So by default they still do what they used to (lava_tube), but you can pass scenario to override it, for example:

    roslaunch subt_example jackal.launch scenario:=cave

    or

    roslaunch subt_example iris.launch scenario:=cave

    or 

    roslaunch subt_example husky.launch scenario:=cave

Updates 1b43c62

  • Outside staging area
  • Using the pre-existing cave entrance as a placeholder for now
  • Scaled blockers so they cover the whole exit
  • Support rectangular layouts for longer caves
  • Outside lighting

title: Randomized cave tiles
